titleStmt.title: An answer made by command of Prince Henry to certain propositions of warre and peace delivered to His Highnesse by some of his military servants whereunto is adjoyned The French charity, or, An essay written in French by an English gentleman, upon occasion of Prince Harcourt's coming into England, and translated into English by F.S.J.E.
titleStmt.author: Cotton, Robert, Sir, 1571-1631.
Evelyn, John, 1620-1706. French charity.

notesStmt.note: "The French charity" has special t.p. and separate paging.
Translation of "The French charity" sometimes ascribed to John Evelyn -- NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
